org.gearvrf

Class GVRLODGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRComponent
        • org.gearvrf.GVRBehavior
          • org.gearvrf.GVRLODGroup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GVRDrawFrameListener

    public final class GVRLODGroup
extends GVRBehavior
    Example: 
     root = new GVRSceneObject(..);

 sphereHighDensity = new GVRSceneObject(..);
 sphereMediumDensity = new GVRSceneObject(..);
 sphereLowDensity = new GVRSceneObject(..);

 GVRLODGroup lodGroup = new GVRLODGroup(gvrContext);
 lodGroup.addRange(0, sphereHighDensity);
 lodGroup.addRange(5, sphereMediumDensity);
 lodGroup.addRange(9, sphereLowDensity);
 root.attachComponent(lodGroup);

    • Method Detail

      • getComponentType

        public static long getComponentType()

      • addRange

        public void addRange(float range,
                     GVRSceneObject sceneObject)
        Add a range to this LOD group. Specify the scene object that should be displayed in this range. Add the LOG group as a component to the parent scene object. The scene objects associated with each range will automatically be added as children to the parent.
        Parameters:
        range - show the scene object if the camera distance is greater than this value
        sceneObject - scene object that should be rendered when in this range
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if range is negative or sceneObject null

      • onDrawFrame

        public void onDrawFrame(float frameTime)
        Deprecated. 
        Do not call directly.
        Specified by:
        onDrawFrame in interface GVRDrawFrameListener
        Overrides:
        onDrawFrame in class GVRBehavior
        Parameters:
        frameTime - Seconds since the previous frame - see GVRContext.getFrameTime()

      • onAttach

        public void onAttach(GVRSceneObject newOwner)
        Description copied from class: GVRBehavior
        Called when this behavior is attached to a scene object. Attaching a behavior to a scene object will cause it to start listening to scene events.
        Overrides:
        onAttach in class GVRBehavior
        Parameters:
        newOwner - GVRSceneObject the behavior is attached to.

      • onDetach

        public void onDetach(GVRSceneObject oldOwner)
        Description copied from class: GVRBehavior
        Called when this behavior is detached from a scene object. Detaching a behavior from a scene object will cause it to stop listening to scene events (onStep won't be called).
        Overrides:
        onDetach in class GVRBehavior
        Parameters:
        oldOwner - GVRSceneObject the behavior was detached from.
